title: Establish Application Code Repositories
description: As a Development Team, I want the frontend and backend project structures initialized in a monorepo with standardized tooling, so that we can ensure code consistency and begin feature development efficiently.
business_value: Enables parallel development of frontend and backend services within a consistent and maintainable codebase, accelerating feature delivery and reducing configuration overhead.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Initialize Frontend and Backend Projects","given":"A new monorepo is created","when":"The setup scripts are run","then":"A React/Vite project is created for the frontend and a NestJS project is created for the backend, both configured with TypeScript, ESLint, and Prettier."},{"scenario":"Verify Development Environments","given":"Both projects are initialized","when":"A developer runs `npm run dev` in each project directory","then":"The frontend Vite server starts successfully, and the backend NestJS server starts successfully with its default health check endpoint responding."}]
definition_of_done: ["Frontend and Backend projects are created and committed to the repository.","Shared linting and formatting rules are configured and enforced.","Local development environments are documented and verified to work."]

title: Provision Core Network and Database Infrastructure
description: As a DevOps Engineer, I want to define and provision the core AWS networking (VPC) and database (RDS) infrastructure using Terraform, so that we have a secure, highly-available, and scalable foundation for all application services.
business_value: Creates the fundamental, secure cloud environment required to host the application, ensuring reliability, data integrity, and compliance with operational requirements from day one.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Deploy Networking and Database via Terraform","given":"AWS credentials and a Terraform project are configured","when":"`terraform apply` is executed","then":"A new VPC with public/private subnets across at least two Availability Zones is created."},{"scenario":"Verify Database Configuration","given":"The RDS instance has been provisioned","when":"Inspecting the resource in the AWS console","then":"Multi-AZ deployment is enabled, encryption at rest is active, and the automated backup policy is configured for 14-day retention with PITR enabled, meeting REQ-1-044 and REQ-1-047."}]
definition_of_done: ["Terraform code is peer-reviewed and merged.","`terraform apply` completes successfully in the development environment.","VPC and RDS configurations are verified against all related NFRs (REQ-1-046, REQ-1-044, REQ-1-047).","Database credentials are securely stored."]

title: Provision Application Hosting and Identity Infrastructure
description: As a DevOps Engineer, I want to define and provision the AWS infrastructure for application services (ECS, Lambda), API routing (API Gateway), and user identity (Cognito) using Terraform, so that we have a complete, code-defined environment to deploy and run the application.
business_value: Automates the creation of the entire application hosting platform, enabling consistent deployments, scalability, and adherence to the defined system architecture (REQ-1-054).
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Deploy Application Infrastructure via Terraform","given":"The core networking and database infrastructure exists","when":"`terraform apply` is executed for the application services","then":"An ECS Cluster, Task Definition, and Service are created for the backend."},{"scenario":"Verify Cognito User Pool Configuration","given":"The Cognito User Pool is provisioned","when":"Inspecting the resource in the AWS console","then":"The password policy is configured as per REQ-1-071, and the app client is set up for OAuth 2.0 with PKCE as per REQ-1-039."}]
definition_of_done: ["Terraform code for all services is peer-reviewed and merged.","`terraform apply` completes successfully.","All created AWS resources are verified against their respective requirements (e.g., REQ-1-018 for Lambda, REQ-1-071 for Cognito)."]

title: Establish Automated CI/CD Pipeline
description: As a Development Team, I want a fully automated CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions, so that every code change is automatically tested, scanned for security vulnerabilities, built, and deployed, ensuring rapid, reliable, and secure releases.
business_value: Automates the entire software delivery lifecycle, improving developer velocity, enhancing code quality through automated gates, and reducing the risk of manual deployment errors.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Pipeline Execution on Code Push","given":"The GitHub Actions workflow is configured","when":"A developer pushes a code change to a branch","then":"A new workflow run is automatically triggered, executing the lint, test, and security scan stages."},{"scenario":"Automated Deployment to Staging","given":"A change is merged into the main branch","when":"The CI/CD workflow runs","then":"It successfully builds all artifacts, pushes the container to ECR, runs database migrations, applies Terraform changes, and deploys the new version to the staging environment using a Blue/Green strategy."},{"scenario":"Security Scans Block Vulnerable Builds","given":"The security scan stage is configured","when":"A code change introduces a new critical vulnerability","then":"The security scan job fails, and the workflow is blocked from deploying the build, as per REQ-1-048."}]
definition_of_done: ["GitHub Actions workflow files are reviewed and merged.","A successful end-to-end deployment to a non-production environment is verified.","All required stages (Lint, Test, Scan, Build, Deploy) are present and functional.","A failed test or critical security finding correctly stops the pipeline."]

title: Perform basic arithmetic operations
description: As a General User, I want to perform addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division using a clear interface, so that I can accurately and efficiently solve basic mathematical problems.
business_value: Establishes the core, non-negotiable functionality of the calculator, serving as the foundation for all other features and providing the primary value proposition to the user.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Simple Addition","given":"The user has entered the expression '5+3' into the calculator","when":"The user triggers the calculation (e.g., presses the '=' button)","then":"The result '8' is clearly displayed."},{"scenario":"Correct Order of Operations (PEMDAS/BODMAS)","given":"The user has entered the expression '5+3×2'","when":"The user triggers the calculation","then":"The result '11' is displayed, correctly performing multiplication before addition."},{"scenario":"Division by Zero","given":"The user has entered the expression '8÷0'","when":"The user triggers the calculation","then":"A clear, non-destructive error message (e.g., 'Cannot divide by zero') is displayed, and the original input '8÷0' is preserved."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","Unit tests for the calculation logic cover all operators and order of operations, with >90% coverage.","UI is responsive and meets WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility standards.","E2E tests for basic calculations and error handling are implemented and passing."]

title: Use trigonometric functions (sin, cos, tan)
description: As a scientific or technical user (e.g., student, engineer), I want to apply sine, cosine, and tangent functions to numbers in my calculations so that I can accurately solve trigonometric problems relevant to my field of study or work.
business_value: Provides fundamental scientific functionality, fulfilling a core user expectation for a scientific calculator and enabling a wide range of technical and academic problem-solving.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Calculate sine in Degrees mode","given":"the calculator angle mode is set to 'Degrees'","when":"the user enters 'sin(90)' and executes the calculation","then":"the displayed result is '1'."},{"scenario":"Calculate sine in Radians mode","given":"the calculator angle mode is set to 'Radians'","when":"the user enters the expression 'sin(pi/2)' and executes the calculation","then":"the displayed result is '1'."},{"scenario":"Handle undefined tangent calculation","given":"the calculator angle mode is set to 'Degrees'","when":"the user attempts to calculate 'tan(90)'","then":"the system displays a clear error message (e.g., 'Error: Undefined') and the original input 'tan(90)' is preserved."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","Calculations are verified to be correct in all three angle modes (DEG, RAD, GRAD).","UI buttons for sin, cos, tan are implemented and accessible.","Unit tests cover standard angles and edge cases for all three functions."]

title: Switch calculator angle mode
description: As a user, I want to switch the angle mode between Degrees, Radians, and Gradians to ensure my trigonometric calculations are correct for my specific problem.
business_value: Provides fundamental functionality required for a scientific calculator, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of trigonometric operations. This is a core feature that builds user trust.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"User can cycle through all three angle modes","given":"The calculator is in 'Degrees' mode","when":"The user interacts with the angle mode control","then":"The mode changes to 'Radians' and the UI indicator updates to 'RAD'."},{"scenario":"Calculation uses the mode active at the time of execution","given":"The user has entered the expression 'sin(90)' while in 'Degrees' mode","when":"The user switches the mode to 'Radians' and then executes the calculation","then":"The result is calculated based on 'Radians' mode, yielding approximately '0.89399'."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","UI control for mode switching is implemented and accessible.","UI indicator for the active mode is implemented and always visible.","E2E tests verify that calculations in all trig functions respect the currently selected mode."]

title: Input numbers using SI prefixes
description: As an electronics engineer, I want to input numerical values using standard SI prefixes like 'k' for kilo and 'n' for nano, so that I can enter calculations quickly and accurately without manually converting to scientific notation.
business_value: Enhances user efficiency and reduces input errors for the target audience. Increases the application's competitiveness as a professional-grade scientific and electronics tool.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Correctly parse large-magnitude SI prefixes","given":"The user is entering an expression","when":"The user types the expression '1.2k + 3M'","then":"The system correctly calculates the result as 3001200."},{"scenario":"Correctly parse small-magnitude SI prefixes","given":"The user is entering an expression","when":"The user types the expression '500m + 10μ'","then":"The system correctly calculates the result as 0.50001."},{"scenario":"System rejects invalid case for SI prefixes","given":"The user is entering an expression","when":"The user types '10K' (uppercase K)","then":"The system displays a non-destructive syntax error message, because 'm' is milli and 'M' is Mega."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","All specified prefixes (p, n, μ, m, k, M, G) are supported.","Parser's tokenizer logic is covered by extensive unit tests.","UI includes a 'μ' button for easy access."]

title: Calculate Ohm's Law and Power values
description: As an electronics practitioner, I want to enter any two known values for Voltage, Current, Resistance, or Power, so that the calculator automatically computes the remaining two values, saving me time and preventing manual calculation errors.
business_value: Provides a core, high-utility feature for the target electronics audience, increasing the application's value proposition and user engagement by simplifying a common and critical calculation.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Calculate Resistance and Power from Voltage and Current","given":"The user is in the Ohm's Law & Power mode","when":"The user enters a valid Voltage (e.g., '12V') and a valid Current (e.g., '500mA')","then":"The Resistance field is automatically populated with '24Ω' AND the Power field is populated with '6W'."},{"scenario":"Insufficient input for calculation","given":"The user is in the Ohm's Law & Power mode","when":"The user has entered a value in only one field","then":"The other three fields remain empty and a message is displayed prompting for 'Enter any two values to calculate'."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","All six possible calculation combinations are implemented and tested.","UI is responsive and provides clear guidance to the user.","Input validation for non-positive R and non-negative P is implemented."]

title: Register for a new user account
description: As a prospective user, I want to create a secure personal account using my email and a strong password, so that I can save my calculation history, custom variables, and user-created modes.
business_value: Enables user-specific data persistence, which increases user retention and engagement. It is a foundational feature for all personalized functionality.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Successful registration with valid credentials","given":"I am on the registration page","when":"I enter a valid unique email, a strong password, confirm the password, accept the ToS, and click 'Register'","then":"My account is created, I am automatically logged in, and I am redirected to the main calculator view."},{"scenario":"Registration attempt with an existing email","given":"I am on the registration page","when":"I enter an email address that already exists in the system","then":"An inline error message 'This email address is already in use.' is displayed."},{"scenario":"Registration attempt with a weak password","given":"I am on the registration page","when":"I enter a password that does not meet the system's security policy","then":"An informative error message is displayed detailing the password requirements (12 chars, mixed case, number, special character)."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","Registration form is responsive and accessible (WCAG 2.1 AA).","E2E tests cover successful registration and all key error conditions.","Backend correctly creates user in Cognito and syncs to the local database."]

title: Log in to an existing user account
description: As a returning user with an existing account, I want to securely log in using my email and password, so that I can access my saved calculation history, variables, and custom modes.
business_value: Enables user-specific data persistence and personalization, which is critical for user retention and engagement. It serves as the gateway to all features that rely on a user's saved state.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Successful login with valid credentials","given":"A registered user is on the login page","when":"The user enters their correct email and password and clicks 'Log In'","then":"The system authenticates the user, establishes a secure session, and redirects to the main calculator view, loading all their persisted data."},{"scenario":"Login attempt with incorrect password","given":"A registered user is on the login page","when":"The user enters their correct email but an incorrect password","then":"A clear, non-specific error message 'Invalid email or password' is displayed to prevent user enumeration."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","Login flow correctly implements OAuth 2.0 with PKCE.","Secure token management is implemented on the client.","Upon login, API calls are made to fetch user-specific data (history, variables, modes)."]

title: Permanently delete my account and all associated data
description: As a registered user, I want to permanently delete my account and all associated data through a secure, multi-step confirmation process, so that I can have full control over my personal information.
business_value: Ensures compliance with data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA), builds user trust by providing data autonomy, and helps maintain data hygiene by removing inactive accounts.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Final confirmation triggers data deletion and logout","given":"the user has correctly entered their username in the confirmation modal","when":"the user clicks the 'Permanently Delete My Account' button","then":"a request is sent to the backend to delete the user's account and all associated data, the user is logged out, and redirected to the login page."},{"scenario":"Backend successfully deletes all user data","given":"the backend has received a valid request to delete a user account","when":"the deletion process is executed","then":"all records associated with the user's ID are permanently removed from all database tables, and the user is deleted from the AWS Cognito user pool."},{"scenario":"Deleted user cannot log in again","given":"a user has successfully deleted their account","when":"the former user attempts to log in with their old credentials","then":"the login attempt fails with an 'Invalid credentials' error."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","E2E test proves that a user and all their associated data are removed from all systems (Cognito, PostgreSQL).","The backend deletion process is transactional to prevent partial deletions.","UI for confirmation is clear and accessible."]

title: Create a new custom calculation mode via a guided wizard
description: As a registered user, I want to use a step-by-step wizard to create a new custom calculation mode, defining its name, description, variables, and formulas, so that I can build personalized tools.
business_value: Enables the core user-extensible functionality, increasing user engagement and retention by allowing users to create personalized tools, transforming the product into a customizable platform.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Initiate wizard and complete all steps successfully","given":"I am a logged-in user","when":"I navigate through the wizard, providing a unique name, at least one input and output variable, and a valid formula, and click 'Save'","then":"The new custom mode is saved to my account and appears in my list of custom modes."},{"scenario":"Attempt to create a mode with a non-unique name","given":"I have an existing mode named 'MyMode'","when":"I try to save a new mode with the name 'MyMode'","then":"An error message 'A mode with this name already exists' is displayed, and the save is prevented."},{"scenario":"Wizard progression is blocked by invalid input","given":"I am in the wizard","when":"I have an invalid formula or have not defined the minimum required variables","then":"The 'Next' or 'Save' button is disabled, preventing me from creating a non-functional mode."}]

title: Launch and use a custom calculation mode
description: As a registered user who has created a custom calculation mode, I want to launch that mode, enter my specific input values, and see the results calculated automatically, so that I can efficiently solve my unique and recurring problems.
business_value: Actualizes the core value of the user-extensible framework, transforming it from a creation tool into a functional, personalized calculator, which drives user engagement and retention.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Perform a successful calculation","given":"I am viewing a launched custom mode with all required input fields","when":"I enter valid numerical values into all required input fields and trigger the calculation","then":"A secure API call is made to the backend formula execution service, and the output fields are populated with the correct calculated results."},{"scenario":"Handle calculation errors from the backend","given":"I am using a custom mode with a formula that can result in a mathematical error (e.g., division by zero)","when":"I enter values that will cause an error and trigger the calculation","then":"The API returns a structured error, and a user-friendly error message is displayed in the UI, preserving my original input values."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","UI dynamically renders a form based on any valid custom mode definition.","API calls to the secure execution Lambda are successful and return correct results.","E2E test covers launching a mode, entering data, and verifying the calculated output."]

title: Operate Core Scientific Calculator Functions While Offline
description: As a user, I want the core scientific calculator functions to remain fully operational after the initial application load, even if my internet connection is lost, so that my workflow is not interrupted.
business_value: Increases application reliability and user trust by providing an uninterrupted core experience, similar to a native application, making the tool dependable in various connectivity conditions.
acceptance_criteria: [{"scenario":"Core calculation functions operate correctly offline","given":"The application is running in offline mode","when":"The user enters an expression using standard arithmetic, trigonometric, and other scientific functions","then":"The calculator correctly computes and displays the result of the expression."},{"scenario":"Application can be reloaded offline after initial visit","given":"The user has visited the application at least once before","when":"The user closes the browser tab, goes offline, and then re-navigates to the application URL","then":"The application loads successfully from the local cache and is fully functional for core calculations."}]
definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","A Service Worker is implemented to cache the application shell.","E2E tests that simulate offline network conditions confirm that core calculations remain functional.","The application can be reloaded without a network connection after the first visit."]

title: Automatically sync offline data upon reconnection
description: As a registered user, I want the application to automatically save any changes I make while offline and sync them to my account when I reconnect, so that my data is safe and available across all my devices without manual intervention.

definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","E2E tests that simulate going offline, making changes, and going back online are implemented and passing.","Conflict resolution logic is explicitly tested and verified.","The IndexedDB queue is correctly managed (items removed on success, retained on failure)."]

definition_of_done: ["All acceptance criteria validated and passing.","The application passes a full WCAG 2.1 Level AA audit with no critical or serious violations.","Automated accessibility checks are integrated into the CI pipeline.","Manual testing with NVDA and VoiceOver screen readers confirms a usable experience for all core user flows."]

description: As a user, I want to access a comprehensive in-app help system from a persistent, global icon, so that I can quickly find clear documentation on any feature without leaving the application.
